item.title: Iowa Votes, and the World Weighs In
item.description: What do they make of the caucus results in Hong Kong? Egypt? And Mexico? (Donald Trump may want to skip these last two.)
item.dc:creator: THE NEW YORK TIMES
item.media:credit: Eric Thayer for The New York Times
item.media:description: Voting at a Republican caucus in Pella, Iowa, on Monday.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: To End Syria’s War, Help Assad’s Officers Defect
item.description: Washington should offer money and asylum to Syrian officers and officials.
item.dc:creator: MOHAMMED ALAA GHANEM

item.title: Op-Ed Columnist: Social Media: Destroyer or Creator?
item.description: A man who helped set off the 2011 Tahrir Square uprising in Egypt has drawn some conclusions about “Facebook revolutions.”
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: THOMAS L. FRIEDMAN
item.media:description: Wael Ghonim, center, in Tahrir Square in Cairo in 2011. His anonymous Facebook page helped start a revolution.

item.title: Sinosphere: ‘Eyes on China’: Illuminating Life Across a Changing Country
item.description: A collective Instagram account provides an informal outlet for many of the professional photographers working in the country.
item.dc:creator: EDWARD WONG

item.title: Gordon Goody, Leader of the Gang in the Great Train Robbery, Dies at 85
item.description: Mr. Goody, who finished a 12-year prison term (and a life of crime) to become a beachfront bar owner in Spain, had been one of three surviving gang members.
item.dc:creator: SAM ROBERTS
item.media:description: Gordon Goody was arrested on Oct. 6, 1963, and served 12 years of a 30-year prison term.

item.title: Zika Virus a Global Health Emergency, W.H.O. Says
item.description: In its decision, the World Health Organization highlighted the seriousness of the Zika outbreak, a mosquito-borne virus thought to cause birth defects that has exploded in Latin America, and gave countries powerful tools to fight it.
item.dc:creator: SABRINA TAVERNISE and DONALD G. McNEIL Jr.
item.media:description: A worker conducting fumigation as a preventive measure against the Zika virus at a cemetery on the outskirts of Lima, Peru.

item.title: Gordon Goody, Leader of the Gang in the Great Train Robbery, Dies at 85
item.description: Mr. Goody, who finished a 12-year prison term (and a life of crime) to become a beachfront bar owner in Spain, had been one of three surviving gang members.
item.dc:creator: SAM ROBERTS
item.media:description: Gordon Goody was arrested on Oct. 6, 1963, and served 12 years of a 30-year prison term.

item.title: Zika Infection Transmitted by Sex Reported in Texas
item.description: Officials in Dallas reported that a patient with Zika virus was infected after having sex with an ill individual who had returned from a country where Zika was circulating.
item.dc:creator: DONALD G. McNEIL Jr. and SABRINA TAVERNISE
item.media:description: A transmission electron micrograph of the Zika virus.

item.title: ‘A Raisin in the Sun’ Through the Eyes of Afro-Swedes
item.description: The 1959 play portrayed the struggles of a poor African-American family. A production in Stockholm points to Sweden’s decreasing tolerance.
item.dc:creator: ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH
item.media:description: Rehearsals for “A Raisin in the Sun,” in preparation for the first major production of the play to open in Sweden. From left, Asha Ali (in back) as Beneatha Younger, David Lenneman as Walter Lee Younger, Kayo Shekoni as Lena Younger and Anna Thiam as Ruth Younger.

item.title: Saudi Court Spares Poet’s Life but Gives Him 8 Years and 800 Lashes
item.description: A court revised the punishment given to a stateless Palestinian poet, Ashraf Fayadh, who was convicted of apostasy. He was also sentenced to eight years in prison.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD

item.title: World Briefing: Malaysia: Swiss Case Excludes Premier
item.description: Prime Minister Najib Razak is not among those accused of wrongdoing in an investigation about of corruption involving the 1Malaysia Development Berhad sovereign fund.
item.dc:creator: REUTERS

item.title: World Briefing: Nigeria: Ship’s Hijackers Make a Threat
item.description: Nigerian separatists threatened to blow up a merchant ship if the authorities do not release a separatist leader seeking the independence of Biafra.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Somalia: Plane Lands After Explosion
item.description: The plane, operated by Daallo Airlines and headed to Djibouti, was forced to land minutes after taking off from Mogadishu.
item.dc:creator: THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing: Spain: Socialist Aims to Form Coalition
item.description: King Felipe VI asked the leader of the Socialist party, Pedro Sánchez, to try to form a coalition government and break Spain’s political deadlock after inconclusive elections.
item.dc:creator: RAPHAEL MINDER

item.title: New Offensive by Assad’s Forces Overshadows Syria Peace Talks
item.description: Government bombing attacks around Homs and Aleppo were supported by intensive Russian airstrikes.
item.dc:creator: NICK CUMMING-BRUCE
item.media:description: The head of the Syrian government delegation, Bashar al-Jaafari, arriving for a meeting with the United Nations mediator, Staffan de Mistura, on Tuesday in Geneva.

item.title: New Western Wall Prayer Space Highlights Wider Divide Among Jews
item.description: Now the question is whether the new prayer space at the wall is a step toward more fundamental change or only a resolution to a localized problem.
item.dc:creator: ISABEL KERSHNER
item.media:description: Ultra-Orthodox Jewish men and women prayed on Tuesday in different sections at the Western Wall in Jerusalem’s Old City.

item.title: Muslim Conference Calls for Protection of Religious Minorities
item.description: The gathering in Morocco of muftis, theologians and scholars issued a declaration welcomed by many as a hopeful sign, though also seen with some skepticism.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: AIDA ALAMI
item.media:credit: Sergey Ponomarev for The New York Times
item.media:description: Yazidis from Sinjar Province in Iraq after their arrival on the Greek island of Lesbos from Turkey in November.

item.title: 18 Elephants on a Plane: Move From Swaziland to U.S. Is Criticized
item.description: Three zoos formed a partnership to house the elephants, which were said to be threatened by habitat destruction and drought, but conservationists said the move imperiled the animals.
item.dc:creator: CHRISTINE HAUSER
item.media:description: In 2003, animal and elephant welfare groups opposed a plan to move 11 elephants from this group in Swaziland to the United States.

item.title: Australia Confirms 2 Cases of Zika Virus
item.description: The two people were probably infected on a trip to Haiti, health officials said, and they have recovered.
item.dc:creator: MICHELLE INNIS

item.title: Francisco Flores, Ex-President of El Salvador, Dies at 56
item.description: Mr. Flores was facing charges of diverting $15 million in contributions for earthquake victims to his personal and political party accounts.
item.dc:creator: SAM ROBERTS
item.media:description: Francisco Flores, the former president of El Salvador, in court in San Salvador last year.
